intro: Sida haenkeana, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and agricultural fields. Sida haenkeana is also known for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional medicine.
